chapter.title: Culminating Activity
chapter.content:
Now that you have completed all the modules in Integrating Technology in the Adult Education Classroom, you will have the opportunity to apply the concepts learned from this course to redesign a unit or lesson plan you already use in your classroom by integrating technology into it.

The Technology Integration Action Plan was developed to help you think through the considerations when planning for integrating technology. The full plan is comprised of three parts:

  • Part 1 – Applying the POST Method
  • Part 2 – Planning for Integrating Technology
  • Part 3 – Reflecting on Integrating Technology

Download the complete Technology Integration Action Plan template here.

To help you get started, view a sample completed Technology Integration Action Plan template.

Steps to completing the Technology Integration Action Plan:

  1. Select a unit/lesson that you currently use in your classroom.
  2. Complete Part 1 of the Technology Integration Action Plan on Applying the POST Method.
  3. Select a technology tool to explore and integrate into your unit/lesson.
  4. Complete Part 2 of the Technology Integration Action Plan on Planning for Integrating Technology.
  5. Revise your unit/lesson.
  6. Implement your revised unit/lesson with your students.
  7. At the completion of implementing your revised unit/lesson, assess your results.
  8. Complete Part 3 of the Technology Integration Action Plan on Reflecting on Integrating Technology.

When you are finished redesigning your lesson plan, we invite you to share it with others in the LINCS Technology and Learning Group in the LINCS Community. We encourage you to revisit the LINCS Technology and Learning Group periodically to learn from others and share your experiences with integrating technology.

chapter.title: Thank you!
chapter.content:
Extended Learning in the LINCS Community

Congratulations on completing the Integrating Technology in the Adult Education Classroom course! Stay involved in the LINCS Community and the LINCS Technology and Learning Group as you work to continue to integrate technology in your classroom. If you shared a redesigned lesson that you created in the culminating activity, we encourage you to revisit the LINCS Technology and Learning Group in a month to reflect on your progress and its effectiveness. Share what worked and what you may have changed based on your experience executing the plan.

Throughout the year, the LINCS Technology and Learning Group in the LINCS Community hosts discussions and activities where additional technology tools and more advanced examples of integration for instruction are introduced by the SME moderator, guest speakers, and group members. As you work toward increased technology integration in your classroom, we recommend that you continue your professional development by sharing, learning, and participating in the LINCS Technology and Learning Group. Technology is ever-evolving and being active in the LINCS Technology and Learning Group is a great way to stay current on the latest tools.
